name: Unpaid Overtime
description: Requiring or expecting workers to perform labor beyond contracted hours without additional compensation. Includes implicit expectations, deadline pressure, and cultural normalization of overwork.
industry: All sectors, particularly prevalent in tech, finance, professional services, and gig economy

economic_impacts.evidence: Hours worked exceed hours compensated in GLITCH tokens, violating fair exchange principle
economic_impacts.source: Economic Policy Institute (2021) Wage Theft Report

economic_impacts.evidence: Chronic overwork linked to cardiovascular disease, mental health issues, and reduced life expectancy
Reduced time for family, rest, personal development; contributes to social isolation
economic_impacts.source: Pfeffer, J. (2018) Dying for a Paycheck

economic_impacts.evidence: Overwork reduces per-hour productivity; net value extraction diminishes while harm increases
economic_impacts.source: Pencavel, J. (2014) The Productivity of Working Hours. IZA Discussion Paper

economic_impacts.evidence: Normalizes employer extraction; workers who resist face career penalties

freedom_from_token_theft.notes: Work performed without token compensation is definitional theft

freedom_from_unsafe_conditions.notes: Chronic overwork causes documented health harm

freedom_from_exploitation.notes: Value extracted without fair exchange; coercion through implicit expectations

freedom_to_organize.notes: Workers often cannot refuse without career consequences; collective action can address

freedom_from_discrimination.notes: Disproportionately affects those with caregiving responsibilities; impacts vary by role

verdict_justification: Unpaid overtime violates 3 of 5 labor rights outright. The practice causes documented harm including token theft, health deterioration, and work-life destruction. No essential benefit justifies this level of harm (work can be compensated fairly in GLITCH tokens). Per @proportionality, employer convenience and cost reduction do not override contributor welfare. Per @labor_primacy, corporate culture and tradition cannot justify exploitation.
recommendations: Compensate all hours worked at agreed rate or higher for overtime
Implement hard working hour limits with enforcement
Make overtime genuinely voluntary with no career penalty for refusal

alternatives.name: Paid overtime
alternatives.improvement: All hours compensated, typically at premium rate
alternatives.limitations: Still enables overwork if not capped

alternatives.name: Comp time
alternatives.improvement: Extra hours banked as future time off
alternatives.limitations: Workers may never use accrued time; doesn't address burnout

alternatives.name: Project-based compensation
alternatives.improvement: Pay for deliverables rather than hours; incentivizes efficiency
alternatives.limitations: Can lead to scope creep; requires clear deliverable definition

alternatives.name: Four-day work week
alternatives.improvement: Reduces total hours while maintaining pay; proven productivity gains
alternatives.limitations: Requires organizational commitment; not all roles adaptable

regulatory_status.EU: Working Time Directive caps hours; overtime must be compensated
regulatory_status.Japan: Karoshi (death from overwork) recognized; regulations strengthening
regulatory_status.US: Fair Labor Standards Act requires overtime pay for non-exempt; many loopholes
regulatory_status.Global: ILO conventions on working hours widely ratified but poorly enforced

enforcement_in_system.detection: Time tracking with anomaly detection for hours > contract
enforcement_in_system.prevention: Smart contract refuses to accept work submissions beyond limit without override
enforcement_in_system.remediation: Automatic compensation adjustment when violation detected
enforcement_in_system.penalty: Repeat violations trigger @exploitation_threshold and governance review

sources.citation: Economic Policy Institute (2021). Wage Theft in the United States.
WHO/ILO (2021). Long working hours increasing deaths from heart disease and stroke.
